**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-13T17:43:29Z" title="05/13/2015 05:43  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 13, 2015</time> by Red Iron Crown**
You are joking ? Why not simply read the wiki links ?

Well, the first wiki link is every ISO standard ever, I'm not sure what you are suggesting or how it would work in game with #4.

#5 is the Claw if I understand you correctly.

#6 is a list of a lot of business terms (most of which I'm familiar with, it's the area of my education). Which of them are you suggesting be implemented, and how?

#3 doesn't make sense to me, what are you suggesting exactly?

I'm not dismissing your ideas, just trying to understand what you are suggesting exactly.

> 
> 1. Navball numbers and Altimeter GUI are too washed out. I cannot see them good on my monitor. They can be made more crisp ?

I agree, I use EnhancedNavBall mod to scale up the Navball (granted my eyesight is terrible), but I wish it was stock. I know you can scale the GUI in the settings but I don't want to scale the whole thing, just the parts with small text. Altimeter looks fine though, unless you are trying to read the analog version, but I have no idea why that is even there really. You can also use Texture Replacer to put a better NavBall texture. I use a [high contrast black & white navball](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/39748012114704884/FB5A91FB87D21C91646FC75017C70D63AA6D0E45/) which make it a lot easier to see.

> 
> 2. We need a default compass (N, S, E and V).

It wouldn't make much sense in space. Heading should be all you need. Just remember 0 = N, 90 = E, 180 = S, and 270 = W. The numbers on the runway indicate it's direction too btw. Heading / 10.

> 
> 3. Can we colect data from the debris, debris (ship parts etc.) that may degrade over time in space ? Debris may become smaller over time and thus degrade in space.

Yes, you can collect science data from any debris that is not destroyed by recovering it.

only understand #1 and i completely agree. The worst thing is the vertical speed indicator, the numbers are so blurred that it's impossible to read... With a read-able vertical speed indicator and a TWR/DeltaV reader i would uninstall KER
1) Check your settings. In 1.0 they added a transparency slider and its default set to like 75 or something. I noticed it right away. Sliding it to full makes it look better.
